required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Probiotics in Immune System of Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Colonization, Safety, Tolerance, and Effects of Three Probiotic Strains on the Immune System of Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock:
The present report describes the design of a clinical trial performed on healthy adult individuals to check whether the daily intake of the new Hero strains contribute to intestinal colonization, under safe and tolerable conditions, with a positive contribution to health and wellbeing of healthy individuals.
Daily intake of one or several probiotic strains, (CNCM I-4034, CNCM I-4035, CNCM I-4036), increases intestinal microbiota in healthy adults, being safe and well tolerated. The regular intake has positive effects on the gastrointestinal and immune system.

detailed_description.textblock:
The project will be based on a double-blind, randomized, and placebo-controlled clinical trial. It will be multi-Centre, with four groups plus a control group.
The colonization performed by the strains and the modification of the intestinal microbiota will be evaluated by means of strain identification with RT-PCR equipped with specific primers, and bacterial population counting with in situ immunofluorescence techniques.
The safety of strain intake will be evaluated with physical examination, blood parameters, and test son faeces to check for resistance to ampicillin and tetracycline by lactic flora.
Tolerance will be evaluated by means of the record of gastrointestinal symptoms and the record of aspect and frequency of faeces.
The effect on the systemic and adaptive immune system will be measured by means of lymphocyte populations and plasma cytokine present on blood, IgAs on serum, saliva and faeces. Also AGCC on faeces.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks of the treatments. Daily recorded.
primary_outcome.description: Tolerance of these probiotic strains was determined using the gastrointestinal symptom rating scale (GSRS), daily recorded gastrointestinal symptoms and defecation frequency.Intolerance was defined as a symptom score of 2 or higher on the GSRS. The unit of measure is the "number of participants" was tolerant to the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gastrointestinal and Immune Effects of Probiotics Consumption.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Time zero, after 4 weeks, and 2 later.
secondary_outcome.description: Effect on the systemic and adaptive immune system. This will be measured by means of lymphocite populations and plasma cytokine present on blood, IgAs on serum (at zero time and after four weeks of treatment), IgAs on saliva and faeces and AGCC (at zero time and after four weeks and two more weeks). Gastrointestinal effects will be measured by means of gastrointestinal symptoms record and frequency and aspect of faeces, during the treatment and the following two weeks (wash-out period).

arm_group.description: Volunteers are given Probiotic CNCM I-4036.
Volunteers receive Probiotics CNCM I-4035 and CNCM I-4036.

intervention.description: Probiotic CNCM I-4034 in a concentration of 9x10E9 cfu (colony forming unit) per day during 28 days.
9x10E9 cfu (colony forming unit) per day during 28 days.
9x10E9 cfu (colony forming unit) per day during 28 days.

intervention.intervention_name: Probiotics CNCM I-4035 and CNCM I-4036
intervention.description: 9x10E9 cfu (colony forming unit) per day during 28 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult
- Age: 18-50 years
- Normal defecation
- Normal blood parameters
- Body Mass Index: 18-30
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Lactation
- Antibiotic treatment
- Gastrointestinal disease
- Diarrhoea
- Constipation
- Diabetes
- Abnormal blood pressure
- Allergy
- Smoker

baseline.population: The average age was 28 years in all groups. Gender male/female in Probiotic groups 37/43 and placebo groups 9/11. Regi√≥n of enrollment were Granada, Murcia and Valencia cities placed in southeast of Spain.

outcome.title: Gastrointestinal Tolerance After Probiotic Consumption.
outcome.description: Tolerance of these probiotic strains was determined using the gastrointestinal symptom rating scale (GSRS), daily recorded gastrointestinal symptoms and defecation frequency.Intolerance was defined as a symptom score of 2 or higher on the GSRS. The unit of measure is the "number of participants" was tolerant to the intervention.
outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks of the treatments. Daily recorded.
outcome.population: Calculation of simple size was based on the variance in the probiotic strain count (log strain CFU/g) in feces and a difference of 25% compared with the placebo. alfa: 0.05 power 90%

measure.title: Gastrointestinal Tolerance After Probiotic Consumption.
measure.description: Tolerance of these probiotic strains was determined using the gastrointestinal symptom rating scale (GSRS), daily recorded gastrointestinal symptoms and defecation frequency.Intolerance was defined as a symptom score of 2 or higher on the GSRS. The unit of measure is the "number of participants" was tolerant to the intervention.
measure.population: Calculation of simple size was based on the variance in the probiotic strain count (log strain CFU/g) in feces and a difference of 25% compared with the placebo. alfa: 0.05 power 90%

outcome.title: Gastrointestinal and Immune Effects of Probiotics Consumption.
outcome.description: Effect on the systemic and adaptive immune system. This will be measured by means of lymphocite populations and plasma cytokine present on blood, IgAs on serum (at zero time and after four weeks of treatment), IgAs on saliva and faeces and AGCC (at zero time and after four weeks and two more weeks). Gastrointestinal effects will be measured by means of gastrointestinal symptoms record and frequency and aspect of faeces, during the treatment and the following two weeks (wash-out period).
outcome.time_frame: At Time zero, after 4 weeks, and 2 later.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected during the first washout (15 days) intervention period (28 days) and second wasout period (15 days). The assessment was performed using Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale questionnaire (GSRS)

event.sub_title: abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, hard stools, acid regurgitation, eructation...

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release.
